title: Vel’Koz could be a Watcher
body:
The “Eye is the Void” was released in the weird limbo of lore that existed in proximity to the Retcon, he lacks extensive lore in the form of an updated long bio and short story.  

He does have an updated short bio that makes mention of Vel’Koz perhaps being one of the first Voidborn to emerge into Runeterra.  

Referring to his origin in this way leads me to believe that Vel’Koz is very, very old.  While potentially all of the void champions are timeless, Vel’Koz could be the one with the longest rap sheet. 

What we know about the Watchers is that they are the masters of the Void. How this is accomplished or to what ends are unclear, but as of writing, the Freljord lore of the early relationship between Iceborn and Watchers ended with the battle on the Howling Abyss.  The Watchers were Imprisoned by a magical bridge built by Ornn.  

Art in concepts related to the Watchers can be seen as reminiscent of Vel’Koz’ design, large eyes, and tentacles. 

So I believe that when the Void is revisited in the future, Vel’Koz will take a level in Badass and ascend the hierarchies of the Void.  

My other question, could the ancient Iceborn be somehow similar to the Ascended of Shurima?

replies.body:
Well, even if Riot could retcon his lore and change it 180 degree, I doubt that. For reasons...

First reason, Vel'Koz with his voice lines doesn't show a strong malevolent personality. Actually, he is curious. He is a champion that wants to understand how things work but lacking morality inevitably pushes him to have terrible actions for learning. His primary goal is not destroying Runeterra, or universe. He just wants to learn, and for that, he destroys. I think he would be against the total annihilation, given his curiosity for knowledge. (Since nothingness excludes knowledge too)

His obsession for knowledge as well as not giving a damn about anything except knowledge is unique and It shouldn't be removed. And if you don't remove, you can't have a watcher.

Other reason, a watcher champion means HYPE. A hype that would be insane. And It shouldn't be wasted with Vel'Koz when it is already a risky move. You can disappoint readers and waste a potential at the same.

Last reason, even though there are similarities, Vel'Koz doesn't resemble a watcher in appearance that much. In Bard teaser, a watcher has arms, many of them, in one of watcher concepts, there are far more beasty and less alien like compare to Vel'Koz. This gives me the idea that Riot is considering watchers to be unique, rather than retconning a champion to be a watcher.

So, that’s rather convincing.  Then what climax could Vel’Koz’ character be working towards?   If he could be turned against complete anihilation, could he be turned from the Void itself, even though he still calls it home?   

Why are voidlings capable of self-identifying?

The thing about Voidborn (I'm including Kai'Sa and Malzahar in this list as well) is that they all talk about having a specific _purpose._ You can hear it in their lines.

{{champion:145}} "This is my purpose. Learn from me." She illustrates the Void's power and how to fight back against it.
{{champion:90}} "FOR THE VOID!" I mean, he's called the Herald of the Void for a reason. His purpose is to invite it into Runeterra.
{{champion:121}} "My purpose is eating deadly creatures. My hobby? Eating Yordles." He adapts to the creatures he consumes, possibly also eliminating threats at the same time.
{{champion:161}} "I require additional subjects." Vel'Koz learns about the world by destroying and analyzing its denizens.
{{champion:31}}  "I shall bring them terror." Cho's purpose seems to be inspiring fear of the Void and tormenting mortals in general.
{{champion:96}} "NEED FOOD!" Kog's just a baby so it makes sense that he's a little bit simplistic. But the need to consume in order to grow and understand is still there.

I would suspect that the Voidborn act as a set of Avatars for the Void. Therefore they have a bit further degree of separation than most of its more simplistic forms.

Well, I don't think he would care until it reaches to a point that even he may worry. 

Vel'Koz is pretty neutral in sides. He doesn't side with the Void, he doesn't side with Runeterra. He is something by his own. We see that with his killing other voidborns because they were on his path.

I imagine that may change in the future though. This is just we have in our hands now. Everything we know about him is how isolate he is.
